messages.subject: Re: heat/humidity--wasCompletely Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/8/99 5:34:36 AM Pacific Daylight Time, Buresmom@AOL.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/8/99 5:34:36 AM Pacific Daylight Time, Buresmom@...
writes:

<< Where in Ohio are you, Mary Ellen? I'm in NE OH. Man is this humidity and
heat the pits. You know it's bad when your shins and eyelids sweat!!!
Thak goodness the water guy delivered water for our pool (3 ft x 12 ft)
yesterday. My youngest dd was in it at 7:30 am!!! I was busy working on
portfolios--we're having our assessments tomorrow
Debra
>>

Debra,
I live in a small town called Navarre. It's southwest(I think) of
Canton/Massillon
I'm glad you have a pool. When it gets real bad for me(when my skin feels
STICKY),
I pour a glass of water on myself (this really cracks the kids up), but it
helps!
We had our assessments in April. I can't tell you how relaxed I am after
getting that out of the way! Who does your assessments?
Mary Ellen.(starting to sweat at 9:45a.m.)

messages.subject: Re: heat/humidity--wasCompletely Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 06/07/1999 7:05:50 PM Eastern Daylight Time, Kitchen38@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 06/07/1999 7:05:50 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Kitchen38@... writes:

<< Yep, We are. I feel that life is educational. As the old saying
goes..."You
learn something new everyday." Today I learned that I can't function well
when the temperature gets above 90 degrees. Or is it the humidity that's
making me crazy? Anyway, I feel like my mind and body both are traveling in
slow motion.
Mary Ellen (sweating in Ohio).
>>
Where in Ohio are you, Mary Ellen? I'm in NE OH. Man is this humidity and
heat the pits. You know it's bad when your shins and eyelids sweat!!!
Thak goodness the water guy delivered water for our pool (3 ft x 12 ft)
yesterday. My youngest dd was in it at 7:30 am!!! I was busy working on
portfolios--we're having our assessments tomorrow
Debra
